alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 25 at 4:15AM AKDT until October 26 at 5:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 AM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 7 inches, highest amounts from Soldotna north to Nikiski. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...From 8 AM this morning to 5 AM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will overspread the area from south to north this morning. Warming temperatures will lead to a change to rain for communities along Kachemak Bay by midday. Precipitation may also mix with or change to rain as far north as Clam Gulch this afternoon and evening. The heaviest snow will fall near Cook Inlet, including the Sterling Highway corridor, between about Noon and 8pm.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
